name: West Coast Grilled Fish

ingredients.name: skinless fish fillets such as cod, snapper, or salmon

preparation:
1. Preheat grill to medium heat. 
  2. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together mustard, honey, and seasoning. It will be a thick sauce.  
  3. Rub fish with oil, season with salt and pepper. Spread top with about 1⁄3 of the sauce. Place on grill, non-sauced side down. Barbecue, with lid closed, 2–3 min.  
  4. Gently flip and spread the other side with another 1⁄3 of the sauce. Barbecue 2–3 min.  
  5. Flip once more and spread remaining sauce on top. Grill an additional 1–2 min, until desired doneness.
tips: Don’t let grilling fish intimidate you! Fish is delicate, start with a clean grill to prevent sticking and make sure to choose fish fillets that are at least 1” thick. Firm fleshed fish like salmon, trout, cod, or snapper are excellent choices.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup grilled potatoes, 2 cups mixed greens, and 1 tbsp Epicure Dressing, your choice.
